intro: Obione humifusa, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The flowers bloom in the summer, producing a yellow disk surrounded by white ray florets.
